description:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. As a Programs Specialist, you will enthusiastically represent the Google brand and build our talent pipeline. Whether it’s making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you will have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You'll be focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams.

The Student Development (SD) team is a part of Talent and Outreach Programs and serves to create experiences that provide students from all backgrounds equal access to learning and career opportunities at Google and beyond. In addition, we support Google’s mission to increase the diversity of future Googlers by managing key development programs focused on serving students who identify with underrepresented backgrounds. Student Development is made up of the Pre-College, College, and Engagement pods. As a Student Development Specialist, you will focus on the College pod.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants, and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them". We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Track record of successfully delivering on outcomes and managing to stretch performance goals/metrics.
  • Ability to work with multiple groups and functions, including remote teams.
  • Ability to create and deliver compelling presentations to diverse groups of stakeholders.
  • Ability to build effective personal networks across a complex, fast-moving organization.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Oversee the management of the Scholarships program, including application publication, collection, and review processes.
  • Work with our external partners to renew agreements and collaborate on communications and review processes.
  • Recruit, train, and address volunteer questions and feedback. Identify solutions for immediate improvements.
  • Identify opportunities for long-term program improvement and manage improvement projects with some guidance.
  • Manage summer event planning and execution.
title: Student Development Specialist, College
